The first active date as known to the customer asthe first date where the arrangement was firstoperational in a customer service context is notthis date.

APL_LVL_CL.label: Application Level Cl
APL_LVL_CL.desc: Application Level defines if rows are to be inserted in KS, apd_ar_cd_rltnp, in subtypes or not inserted at all. Specifies at what relationship level in the productengine the conditon is copied and a what level thecondition can be changed. * Prodlaw: Product conditions specified by 'prodlaw' areconditions that always apply to an arrangement under this product. If acondition of this type is changed, the change will be effective for all arrangements under this product without regard to theconditions of the individual arrangements. Conditions of this type are NOT copied to the arrangement but are found in APD_CD_RLTNPand are used at arrangement level for validation. This means that thearrangement complies with the conditions of this type at productlevel and they must be read from here (APD_CD_RLTNP).

LDB_ID.label: LDB Id
LDB_ID.desc: Contains the financial institution's logical database identifier (LDBID). The LDBID isassigned when the system is created at the financial institution. All LDBIDs that have been allocated to thefinancial institutions and are used by theaccounting centre.

CNTER_PSTG_EXT_REFR.label: Counter Posting External Reference
CNTER_PSTG_EXT_REFR.desc: The reference to the external channel creating theposting (not to be mistaken as the Transaction Channel Id) Part of the unique identification in the source system Kerne.

ACG_EFF_TP_CL.label: Accounting Effect Type Cl
ACG_EFF_TP_CL.desc: Accounting Effect Type classifies Posting Entriesbased on whether they increase or decrease thebalance of a particular type of Accounting Unit. *Domain * Credit Debit No Credit/Debit

DLV_DVC_TP_NM.label: Delivery Device Type Name
DLV_DVC_TP_NM.desc: Contains the delivery reference (a uniqueidentification of the 'delivery' that the accountingentry is part of). The debit entries must match the credit entries in theaccounting entries of a delivery reference, even ifaccounting entries are created both for clearing and entry. The reference is used tobalance a part delivery from the same system inerror situations.

PSTG_ENTR_MODE_CL.label: Posting Entry Mode Cl
PSTG_ENTR_MODE_CL.desc: Contains the status type of the posting entry. It isused by the Financial Institution to follow-up on postingentries. DOMAIN: * Completed after offline * Batch * Online

DSC_TX_CODE.label: Description Text Code
DSC_TX_CODE.desc: Contains the token values for a statement text foran accounting entry. Token values contain thevalues (for example, cheque number, cashing date,and so on), which are to be incorporated into thestatement text (in Danish, English, or anotherlanguage). As the attribute can contain several values, these areprefixed with the 'at' sign.

ARCHV_DT.label: Archive Date
ARCHV_DT.desc: Contains the file date (the date when the entry wasdata-captured).

ARCHV_OU_NO.label: Archive Orginization Unit Number
ARCHV_OU_NO.desc: Contains the file registration number of the Financial Institution. It specifies the branch numberfor the location of the actual vouchers for theentry.

FRCD_TRX_F.label: Forced Transaction Flag
FRCD_TRX_F.desc: Contains an indication of whether or not theapplication of the posting entry was forced (it wascompleted in spite of checks rejecting it: for example, in connection with anoverdraft). The information can be used for follow-up of the day's posting entries.

ORIG_AMT.label: Original Amount
ORIG_AMT.desc: Contains the amount of a posting, expressed in theoriginal currency of the posting. In other words, itis the monetary value on a financial transaction, aspresented to Corebank. A posting can also containthis monetary value expressed in terms of ABC (the accounting base currency) and the currency of theaccount.

PSTG_AMT.label: Posting Entry Amount
PSTG_AMT.desc: Contains the amount entered to the account; it isspecified in the account currency, regardless of thebasic currency of the system or the originalcurrency of the posting.

MSR_AMT.label: Measurement Amount
MSR_AMT.desc: Contains the original amount of the posting(attribute PSTG_ORGNL_AMT) expressed in termsof ABC (the accounting base currency). This is the basic currency of the system,which holds the Financial Institution's ledgeraccounts.

MSR_CCY.label: Measurement Currency
MSR_CCY.desc: Contains the Measurement Currency aka the Accounting Currency

TXN_BOOK_DT.label: Transaction Book Date
TXN_BOOK_DT.desc: The Financial Institution 'Book' date on which the transaction is recorded. This is the date usedto determine the Financial Period associated with the Transaction. The Book Date of a check depositis the date on which the check is accepted.

FND_AVL_DT.label: Fund Available Date
FND_AVL_DT.desc: Each posting contains three dates: * Effective Date - the date when the posting is tobe entered into Corebank * Available Date - the date when the postingaffects the available balance of the accountarrangement (the balance of funds available to the customer) * Value Date - the date from which the posting willaffect the interest-bearing balance of the accountarrangement (the balance on which interest iscalculated).

UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.label: Unique Id In Source Decimal
UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.desc: Contains the Unique Id in Source Here it represents the TASEG_IDFR

TXN_DOC_ITEM_TP_CL.label: Transaction Document Type Cl
TXN_DOC_ITEM_TP_CL.desc: Contains the medium used for the accountingentry. DOMAIN: * Cheque * Payment card * Book * Card * No media

DSC.label: Description
DSC.desc: Contains a short description of the posting entry

ARCHV_REFR.label: Archive Reference Number
ARCHV_REFR.desc: Contains the file reference (the file key), which is aunique identification of the accounting (posting)entry. It is used to trace the entry back to its site oforigin (in the PSTG entity). It is also added tovouchers (for example, cheques and credit transferforms), in order to facilitate subsequent searches.

PSTG_TXN_DT.label: Posting Transaction Date
PSTG_TXN_DT.desc: The date on which the Transaction actuallyoccurred. In many cases, this will be the same asthe Transaction Book Date but may differ, forexample, where the Transaction takes place on a

TXN_TSM.label: Transaction Timestamp
TXN_TSM.desc: A posting is an accounting entry that affects oneor more balances for an account arrangement.Each posting must be associated with a postingstandard, in order to be accepted by Corebank.The pstg_host_ts attribute contains thetimestamp at which a posting is registered on thehost machine (in the pstg entity).

AR_ID.label: Arrangement Id
AR_ID.desc: The unique identifier of an Account Arrangement.

ACQ_INST_IDENTN.label: Acquirer Institution Identification
ACQ_INST_IDENTN.desc: Contains the acquirer institution of cardtransaction

RCV_CGY_IDENTN.label: Receiver Category
RCV_CGY_IDENTN.desc: Contains the category of the shop where the cardis used. This could be used to identify a special

RCV_TML_IDENTN.label: Receiver Terminal Identification
RCV_TML_IDENTN.desc: Contains the id of the terminal where the card isused. Also written on the note

RCV_NM.label: Receiver Name
RCV_NM.desc: Contains the name of the shop where the card isused

ACT_TXN_TSM.label: Actual Transaction Timestamp
ACT_TXN_TSM.desc: Contains the local timestamp when thetransaction was created

ACQ_REFR_NO.label: Acquirer Reference
ACQ_REFR_NO.desc: Contains a reference generated by the shop or by the card company

CARD_TXN_UNQ_IDENTN.label: Card Transaction Unique Identifiaction
CARD_TXN_UNQ_IDENTN.desc: Contains a unique identification of the purchace

RCV_IDENTN.label: Receiver Identification
RCV_IDENTN.desc: Contains the id of the shop where the card isused.

CTY.label: Country
CTY.desc: Contains the country ISO code for the countrywhere the card is used.

AUD_NO.label: Audit Number
AUD_NO.desc: Contains the audit number if filled by the cardcompany

TML_TXN_REFR_NO.label: Terminal Transaction Reference Number
TML_TXN_REFR_NO.desc: Contains a referencenumber generated by theterminal

EXT_REFR.label: External Reference
EXT_REFR.desc: The reference to the external channel creating theposting (not to be mistaken as the Transaction Channel Id) Part of the unique identification in the source system Kerne.

TXN_REFR_NO.label: Transaction Referenece Number
TXN_REFR_NO.desc: Contain an external referenceidentification of the card posting

CARD_PD_IDENTN.label: Card Product Identification
CARD_PD_IDENTN.desc: Contains card product beeing used if the card isco-branded

PD_CODE.label: Product Code
PD_CODE.desc: The Business Id (Product code from Kerne) to be able toidentify the Product related to the condition

RLTNP_EFF_DT.label: Relationship Effective Date
RLTNP_EFF_DT.desc: The effective date of the relationship between the Account Arrangement and the Condition

ARG_VAL_CL.label: Argument Value Cl
ARG_VAL_CL.desc: Defines the Condition Argument (variable's topic).Defines the argument applicable for the condition. The Argument that distinguishes between Conditionsbased upon the topics that identify the businessrequirement. The Values defined for this Scheme arerepresentative and do not comprise an exhaustive list.

CDN_NM.label: Condition Name
CDN_NM.desc: IF the condition is named in the system this is shownhere

TXT_VAL.label: Text Value
TXT_VAL.desc: The Text Value of a Condition related to the Product(might be spaces if the Condition does not represent atextual value)

DT_VAL_DT.label: Date Value Date
DT_VAL_DT.desc: The Date value of the Condition related to the Product (might be low value '1900-01-01' if the condition doesnot represent a date value)

CDN_EFF_DT.label: Condition Effective Date
CDN_EFF_DT.desc: Shows the Effective Date of the Condition. If the Condition values are changed after the Condition isreleated to the Product then CDN_EFF_DT >RLTNP_EFF_DT

UOM_CL.label: Unit Of Measurement Cl
UOM_CL.desc: If a condition represents a frequency this contains theunique Classification of the predefined frequencies anddefines how to use the other values defined on thecondition. (Might be space if there is no need forspecifications of the other value columns)

SVC_ELMT_ID.label: Service Element Id
SVC_ELMT_ID.desc: The Unique Id For the Service Element

PD_NM.label: Product Name
PD_NM.desc: The primary name assigned to the Product. Thisname is used in reports and documents referringto the Product.

PD_EFF_DT.label: Product Effective Date
PD_EFF_DT.desc: Contains the Effective Date of the most resentversion of the Product

SVC_ELMT_TP_CL.label: Service Element Type Cl
SVC_ELMT_TP_CL.desc: Contains the unique Classification of the type of the Service Element

SVC_ELMT_EFF_DT.label: Service Element Effective Date
SVC_ELMT_EFF_DT.desc: Contains the most recent Effective date of the Service Element

SVC_ELMT_RQM_TP_NM.label: Service Element Requrement Type Nm
SVC_ELMT_RQM_TP_NM.desc: Contains the text value of the above column

BSN_ID.label: Business Id
BSN_ID.desc: A code or short name by which a Product can beidentified; for example, code 'sdepo01' representsa Product named, 'depot in spar nord'. This is asecurity product. It named in native language, DK(Default language for naming classification in EDWis set to be UK English. However this is notcurrently possible to load and maintain). Thecoding and naming of product is specific for the FI.Another example is 'eejer01' that is named'ejerbolig'. This is a Resource Item Product thatrepresents the asset that is to pledged as collateralfor a security arrangement.

PD_X_SVC_ELMT_EFF_DT.label: Product/Service Element Effective Date
PD_X_SVC_ELMT_EFF_DT.desc: Contains the Date on which the Service Elementwas related tp the Product

SVC_ELMT_NM.label: Service Element Name
SVC_ELMT_NM.desc: Contains the Name of the Service Element as defined by the Bank (orthe SYSTEM)

SVC_ELMT_TP_NM.label: Service Element Type Name
SVC_ELMT_TP_NM.desc: Contains the Name of the Service Element

SVC_ELMT_RQM_TP_CL.label: Service Element Requrement Type Cl
SVC_ELMT_RQM_TP_CL.desc: Contains the unique EDW Cl value the relationtype of the Account Product and the Service Element -the domain set includes lckd_ locked mndt_ mandatory optn_ optional prps_ proposed

SVC_ELMT_ID.label: Service Element Id
SVC_ELMT_ID.desc: The Unique Id For the Service Element

BSN_ID.desc: A code or short name by which a Product can beidentified; for example, code 'sdepo01' representsa Product named, 'depot in spar nord'. This is asecurity product. This is a Resource Item Product thatrepresents the asset that is to pledged as collateralfor a security arrangement.

SVC_ELMT_TP_CL.desc: Contains the unique Classification of the type of the Service Element

SVC_ELMT_EFF_DT.desc: Contains the most recent Effective date of the Service Element

ARG_VAL_NM.desc: Contains the Name of the Argument(type) of the Condition

DT_VAL_DT.label: Date Value Date
DT_VAL_DT.desc: The Date value of the Condition related to the Product (might be low value '1900-01-01' if the condition doesnot represent a date value)

UOM_CL.label: Unit Of Measurement Cl
UOM_CL.desc: If a condition represents a frequency this contains theunique Classification of the predefined frequencies anddefines how to use the other values defined on thecondition. (Might be space if there is no need forspecifications of the other value columns)

CDN_ID.label: Condition Id
CDN_ID.desc: The unique EDW Id of the Condition related to the Customer

RLTN_TP_NM.label: Relation Type Name
RLTN_TP_NM.desc: Contians the name of the Type of therelation - Domain: mandatory ,proposed, optional

PD_X_SVC_ELMT_X_CDN_EFF_DT.label: Product/Service Element/Condition Effective Date
PD_X_SVC_ELMT_X_CDN_EFF_DT.desc: Contains the Date on which the Service Element was related tp the Product

SVC_ELMT_NM.label: Service Element Name
SVC_ELMT_NM.desc: Contains the Name of the Service Element as defined by the Bank (orthe SYSTEM)

SVC_ELMT_TP_NM.label: Service Element Type Name
SVC_ELMT_TP_NM.desc: Contains the Name of the Service Element

ARG_VAL_CL.desc: Defines the Condition Argument (variable's topic).Defines the argument applicable for the condition. The Argument that distinguishes between Conditionsbased upon the topics that identify the businessrequirement. The Values defined for this Scheme arerepresentative and do not comprise an exhaustive list.

CDN_EFF_DT.label: Condition Effective Date
CDN_EFF_DT.desc: Shows the Effective Date of the Condition. If the Condition values are changed after the Condition isreleated to the Product then CDN_EFF_DT >RLTNP_EFF_DT

CDN_NM.label: Condition Name
CDN_NM.desc: IF the condition is named in the system this is shownhere

NMBR_VAL.label: Number Value
NMBR_VAL.desc: The Numeric Value on the Condition related to the Product (might be zero/null if the Condition does notrepresent a numeric value)

LDB_ID.label: LDB Id
LDB_ID.desc: Contains the financial institution's logical database identifier (LDBID). The LDBID isassigned when the system is created at the financial institution. All LDBIDs that have been allocated to thefinancial institutions and are used by theaccounting centre.

PRC_EFF_DT.label: Price Effective Date
PRC_EFF_DT.desc: Contains the Effective Date for the Priceinformation

GMI_BID_PRC.label: GMI Bid Price
GMI_BID_PRC.desc: Contains the GMI price regarding sellingpapers

IMM_BID_PRC.label: Immediate Bid Price
IMM_BID_PRC.desc: Contains the price for immediate selling the Papers

TOL.label: Tolerance
TOL.desc: The tolerance reported from the Stock Exchaneg

PRC_RULE_CL.label: Price Rule Cl
PRC_RULE_CL.desc: Contains the unique Classification code for the Price rul

GRP_ST_OPEN_F.label: Group Status Open Flag
GRP_ST_OPEN_F.desc: A Yes/No flag indicating if the Group is openor Not

FI_IMM_OPEN_F.label: Finacial Institution Immediate Open Flag
FI_IMM_OPEN_F.desc: A Yes/No flag indicating if the FI is open for Immediate Trade

OBJ_PD_ID.label: Object Product Id
OBJ_PD_ID.desc: The unique identifier of a Product.

PD_X_PD_TP_CL.label: Product/Product Relantionship Type Cl
PD_X_PD_TP_CL.desc: Contains the Classification Code for the Relation between the Products

SUB_PD_NM.label: Subject Product Name
SUB_PD_NM.desc: Contains the Name of the Subject Product

PD_X_PD_EFF_DT.desc: Contains the most resent Effective Date of the Relationship between the Products

OBJ_PD_CODE.label: Object Product Code
OBJ_PD_CODE.desc: Conatins the Product Code for the Object Product

CDN_NM.label: Condition Name
CDN_NM.desc: IF the condition is named in the system this is shownhere

PD_NM.label: Product Name
PD_NM.desc: The primary name assigned to the Product. Thisname is used in reports and documents referringto the Product.

APL_LVL_CL.label: Application Level Cl
APL_LVL_CL.desc: Application Level defines if rows are to be inserted in KS, apd_ar_cd_rltnp, in subtypes or not inserted at all. Specifies at what relationship level in the productengine the conditon is copied and a what level thecondition can be changed. * Prodlaw: Product conditions specified by 'prodlaw' areconditions that always apply to an arrangement under this product. If acondition of this type is changed, the change will be effective for all arrangements under this product without regard to theconditions of the individual arrangements. Conditions of this type are NOT copied to the arrangement but are found in APD_CD_RLTNPand are used at arrangement level for validation. This means that thearrangement complies with the conditions of this type at productlevel and they must be read from here (APD_CD_RLTNP).

CCY.label: Currency
CCY.desc: If the Codition values are related to a specific Currencythis is shown here (otherwise the column is space)

TXT_VAL.label: Text Value
TXT_VAL.desc: The Text Value of a Condition related to the Product(might be spaces if the Condition does not represent atextual value)

DT_VAL_DT.label: Date Value Date
DT_VAL_DT.desc: The Date value of the Condition related to the Product (might be low value '1900-01-01' if the condition doesnot represent a date value)

EXT_REFR.label: External Reference
EXT_REFR.desc: The external reference of the processcreating the posting (part of theunique identification of a posting)

AR_ID.label: Arrangement Id
AR_ID.desc: The unique identifier of an Account Arrangement.

AC_AR_PRIM_OWN_ID.label: Account Arrangement Primary Owner Id
AC_AR_PRIM_OWN_ID.desc: The Unique Identifier of the Customer

TXN_CNL_CL_CODE.label: Transaction Channel Classification Code
TXN_CNL_CL_CODE.desc: The unique Classification code of the Transation Channel

AC_TXN_TP_NM.label: Account Transaction Type Name
AC_TXN_TP_NM.desc: The Name of the Transaction Type

DLV_DVC_TP_CL.label: Delivery Device Type Cl
DLV_DVC_TP_CL.desc: The unique Classifiaction code of the Delivery Device type, the deliveryreference (a unique identification of the 'delivery' that the accounting entryis part of). Only used for a subset of transactions Domain set TDC bank_ midas dlm_ cbsw_ visa_ pbs atm bbs

PSTG_ENTR_MODE_CL.label: Posting Entry Mode Cl
PSTG_ENTR_MODE_CL.desc: Contains the status type of the posting entry. It isused by the Financial Institution to follow-up on postingentries. DOMAIN: * Completed after offline * Batch * Online

ARCHV_REFR.label: Archive Reference Number
ARCHV_REFR.desc: Contains the file reference (the file key), which is aunique identification of the accounting (posting)entry. It is used to trace the entry back to its site oforigin (in the PSTG entity). It is also added tovouchers (for example, cheques and credit transferforms), in order to facilitate subsequent searches.

DSC_TX.label: Description Text
DSC_TX.desc: A standarized text (formatted by the system) containing information aboutthe posting

DSC_UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.label: Description Unique Id In Source Decimal
DSC_UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.desc: The unique Id in Source system of the Standard Text

RCV_CLRG_IDENT.label: Receiving Clearing Id
RCV_CLRG_IDENT.desc: Clearing Identification on the recieving Fincial Institution

NO_FEE_F.label: No Fee Flag
NO_FEE_F.desc: Flag indicating if a FEE is triggered by the posting

ORIG_AMT_CCY.label: Original Amount Currency
ORIG_AMT_CCY.desc: The currency code of the originalamount

AC_CCY.label: Account Currency
AC_CCY.desc: Contains the currency applied on the Account

MSR_CCY.label: Measurement Currency
MSR_CCY.desc: Contains the Measurement Currency aka the Accounting Currency

OTHR_ORIG_CCY_AMT.label: Other Original Currency Amount
OTHR_ORIG_CCY_AMT.desc: If the channel performs a currencyconversion and the posting arriving in the channel is in another currency thiisis carried through as additionainformation. This is the Original Currency Amountofposting seen from the originatingsystem.

OTHR_EXCHG_RATE.label: Other Exchange Rate
OTHR_EXCHG_RATE.desc: If the channel performs a currencyconversion and the posting arriving in the channel is in another currency thiisis carried through as additionainformation. This is the Original Exchange Rate ofposting seen from the originatingsystem.

TXN_BOOK_DT.label: Transaction Book Date
TXN_BOOK_DT.desc: The Financial Institution 'Book' date on which the transaction is recorded. This is the date usedto determine the Financial Period associated with the Transaction. The Book Date of a check depositis the date on which the check is accepted.

FND_AVL_DT.label: Fund Available Date
FND_AVL_DT.desc: Each posting contains three dates: * Effective Date - the date when the posting is tobe entered into Corebank * Available Date - the date when the postingaffects the available balance of the accountarrangement (the balance of funds available to the customer) * Value Date - the date from which the posting willaffect the interest-bearing balance of the accountarrangement (the balance on which interest iscalculated).

BAL_INCL_DT.label: Balance Included Date
BAL_INCL_DT.desc: This is a derived date - showing onwhich date the posting amount isincluded in Kerne's calculated EODbalances

CNTER_PSTG_AR_ID.label: Counter Posting Arrrangement Id
CNTER_PSTG_AR_ID.desc: If a posting is part of a transactionmaintained in the source system, thisis the Arrangement Id for the Counter Posting Arrangement

REF_AC_AR_NO.label: Reference Account Arrangement Number
REF_AC_AR_NO.desc: The Account number of the Referenced Account Arrangement (Counter Party Account No). When an Counter Party Acoount Number is registrered on a Posting thisis shown in this column

REF_IBAN_AC_NO.label: Reference IBANAccount Number
REF_IBAN_AC_NO.desc: Contains the IBAN no of the referenced Account Arrangement ( Counter Party Account Arrangement)

RCV_CGY_IDENTN.label: Reciever Category Identification
RCV_CGY_IDENTN.desc: Contains the categroy of the shopwhere the card has been used. Onlyvalid for card transactions

CNTPR_CTY.label: Counter Party Country
CNTPR_CTY.desc: Contains the reigstered Country for the Counter Party

CNTPR_NM_2.label: Counter Party Name 2
CNTPR_NM_2.desc: If the name of the Counter Party issplit in more lines this contains thesecond name line

CNTPR_ADR_2.label: Counter Party Address 2
CNTPR_ADR_2.desc: Contains the second Address line of the Counter Party

CAB_CODE_NM.label: Cab Code Name
CAB_CODE_NM.desc: This contains the name related to the MCC code (RCV_CGY_IDENTN)

FI_NM.label: Financial Institute Name
FI_NM.desc: Conatins the name of the Bank/Branchhandling the Posting

FI_ADR_2.label: Financial Institute Address 2
FI_ADR_2.desc: Contains the second Address line of the handling Bank/Branch

FI_CITY_NM.label: Financial Institute City Name
FI_CITY_NM.desc: The Name of the City of the handling Bank/Branch

CLRG_TP_CL.desc: When the counter posting for anaccount lies in the clearing system(outbound clearing) the resulting Clearing Type Classification is shownhere

CLRG_TX.label: Clearing Text
CLRG_TX.desc: Contains a optional text messagerelated to the outbound Clearing

CNTER_PSTG_EXT_REFR.label: Counter Posting External Reference
CNTER_PSTG_EXT_REFR.desc: The reference to the external channel creating theposting (not to be mistaken as the Transaction Channel Id) Part of the unique identification in the source system Kerne.

IP_UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.label: Involved Party Unique Id in Source Dec
IP_UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.desc: The unique Id of the Involved Party(primary owner of the account) in Source System (IP_IDFR)

REF_IP_UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.label: Referenced Involved Party Unique Id in Source Dec
REF_IP_UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.desc: If the Counter Party Involved Party (owner of the counterparty account)exists inside the bank this is the Unique Id in Source (IP_IDFR)

CLRG_REF_AC_AR_NO.label: Clearing Reference Account Arrangement Number
CLRG_REF_AC_AR_NO.desc: When the Counter Posting is in essenceoutbound clearing this contains thecounter party account number

AR_TP_CL.label: Arrangement Type Cl

CARD_TP_CL.label: Carrd Type Cl
CARD_TP_CL.desc: Contains the unique classification codeof the card type if the posting isinitiated by a card transaction

FNC_ACS_OBJ_RI_ID.desc: The unique EDW Id for the Financial Access Object

WALLET_TP.label: Wallet Type
WALLET_TP.desc: The type of the wallet initiating theposting Example: Apple Pay Google Pay ........

EXT_POI_TP_CL.label: External Proof of Identity Type Classification
EXT_POI_TP_CL.desc: When a currency exchange transactionis made through the cashier it ispoosible to relate information about Proof odf Identity to the Posting This contains the unique Classificationof the type of Identity Document

EXT_POI_IDENTN_NO.label: External Proof of Identity Identification Number

CNTR_PARTY_SWISH_MOBILE_NO.label: Counter Party Swish Mobile Number

OWN_SWISH_MOBIL_NO.label: Own Swish Mobile No

ACT_TXN_TMS_CHR.label: Actual Transaction Timestamp Character
ACT_TXN_TMS_CHR.desc: In contrast to TXN_TMS that containsthe timestamp on which thetransaction was created in the source system, this contains the timestamp(formatted as text) when the actualtransction/posting was initiaed outsidethe bank. The format is character based meaningthat the content might vary within thebank, due to differences in deliverychannels

ARCHV_DT.label: Archive Date
ARCHV_DT.desc: Contains the file date (the date when the entry wasdata-captured).

REF_AR_AR_TP_CL.label: Reference Arrangement Arrangement Type Cl
REF_AR_AR_TP_CL.desc: Contains the internal Arrangement Type Cl for the Counter Posting /referenced Arrangement

TXN_USR_IDENTN_NO.label: Transaction User Identification Number
TXN_USR_IDENTN_NO.desc: The user identification stamped on the Posting

AC_AR_NO.label: Account Arrangement No
AC_AR_NO.desc: The Account number of the Arrangment to where the posting iscreated

PD_ID.label: Product Id

TXN_CNL_NM.label: Transaction Channel Name
TXN_CNL_NM.desc: The Name of the Transaction Channel

TXN_CNL_UNQ_ID_SRC_DEC.label: Transaction Channel Unique Id In Source Decimal

Conditions of this type are NOT copied to the arrangement but are found in APD_CD_RLTNPand are used at arrangement level for validation. INTPTN_LVL_CL.label: Interpretation Level Cl
INTPTN_LVL_CL.desc: Defines is Arrangement level can customize or have owninterpretation of Condition. Conditions identify the business rules of an organisation (including the requirements and rules used to manage Corebank, and thus the business side of the Financial Institution). Theseconditions include limitations, amounts, interest rates, intervals,charges, restrictions, and events. A set of conditions is supplied with Corebank. Corebankuses these as templates to automatically generate new conditionswhen, for example, the Financial Institution defines its own interest and feestructures and builds products. New conditions are not generatedif the associated value cannot be changed. The condition can be marked 'system standard' or'product standard', or 'system suggestn' or 'product suggestn' or 'arrngmntvalue'. These marks affect the automatic generation of newconditions. The attribute CDPP_VALUE contains this classification ofa condition, regarding how the value in the condition should beused, in connection with changes to the condition or a selection of it. DOMAIN: The domain includes the following types: * System standard (established by the system; conditioncannot be changed) * System suggestion (established by the system;condition can be changed) * Product standard (created by the product builder;cannot be changed when the arrangement is made) * Product suggestion (created by the product builder;can be changed by the branch employee) * Arrangement value (created by the branch employee).

For aconverted account that was originated in anothercorebanking application this date represent theconversion date. The first active date as known to the customer asthe first date where the arrangement was firstoperational in a customer service context is notthis date.

PNSN_DIVORCE_AR_F.label: Pension Divorce Arrangement Flag
PNSN_DIVORCE_AR_F.desc: Contains an indication of whether the accountarrangement can have special contract textsattached, in respect of a divorce arrangement.

TAX_EXMPT_F.label: Tax Excempted Flag
TAX_EXMPT_F.desc: Contains an indication of whether or not the pensionarrangement is exempt from tax.

EMP_PYMT_PART_PCT.label: Employer Payment Part Percentage
EMP_PYMT_PART_PCT.desc: Contains the employer's share of the contributions toa pension account arrangement in a companyscheme.

AGRD_PYMT_AMT.label: Agreed Payment Amount
AGRD_PYMT_AMT.desc: Contains the agreed contribution to the pensionarrangement.

PYMT_MODE_TP_CL.label: Payment Mode Type Cl
PYMT_MODE_TP_CL.desc: Contains the mode of payment for a pension scheme('contributor status').

FRST_PYMT_TP_CL.label: First Payment Type Cl
FRST_PYMT_TP_CL.desc: Contains details of whether the customer has optedfor a full or partial pension payment for the first year.If full payment is chosen, the customer pays a fullyear's contribution regardless of the first month ofpayment. If partial payment is chosen, the customerpays pro-rata per month.

PYMT_MTH_TP_CL.label: Payment Method Type Cl
PYMT_MTH_TP_CL.desc: Contains an indication of the method (calculationprinciple) to be used for calculating payments

PYMT_FRQ.label: Payment Frequency
PYMT_FRQ.desc: Contains the number of payments per year.

PYMT_FORM_TP_CL.label: Payment Form Type Cl

EXTRA_PYMT_AMT.label: Extraordinary Payment Amount

PYMT_CLRG_NO.label: Payment Clearing Number
PYMT_CLRG_NO.desc: Contains the branch identifier of the receivingaccount when annuity payments are made underannuity pension account arrangements

INDX_BSS_RATE.label: Index Basis Rate
INDX_BSS_RATE.desc: Contains the required basic rate for a Pensionsavings arrangement. The basic rate is supplied by the Danish government to enable cost-of-livingindexation of pensions. The basic interest rate formsthe basis for calculation of the annual deposits andpayments on a Pension savings arrangement. Thebasic rate is therefore not to be used for ordinaryinterest calculations. It is used to calculate theannual deposit requirements and is supplied to the Danish Payments System for payments. This basicrate has not been issued since 1971 and thisattribute is now only used for pensions issued in orbefore 1971.

AR_UNFLD_DT.label: Arrangement Unfullfilled Date
AR_UNFLD_DT.desc: Contains the date from which the pensionarrangement has not been fulfilled (the agreedcontributions have not been made). It is used toreport unfulfilled annuity pension arrangements to

AUTO_FRWD_F.label: Automatic Forwarded Flag
AUTO_FRWD_F.desc: Contains an indication of whether or not the annuitypension has an automated forward to a differentpension type; if a deposit max has been reached.

TAX_AMT.label: Tax Amount
TAX_AMT.desc: Contains the tax amount used in §15A or 15B
